title: If you multiply this number by any other number the answer will be same, what number is this? - Quora

response.answer_text: I would have just said the number or maybe that it’s a four letter word, NOT a three letter word… Why do the answers on Quora need a gazillion paragraphs? We don’t get any extra credit for stretching out the answer to the point that nobody still bothers to read any longer and move on to a different question… or maybe do something else completely unrelated… like the dishes. Or housework. I think this is a third or fourth grade [Catholic School] math lesson. I cannot recall because the Catholic church at the end of my street closed the school after third grade and for fourth grade, I had to go to a different Church’s school three blocks away, and I can’t recall if I learned multiplication in third grade or fourth grade! But I aced math most of my higher-educated life on virtually everything except trigonometry; I even got exempt from taking the final exam Senior year. That was at another Catholic school, an all-male high school. You would almost think I’m pushing Catholic schools! I’m not pushing anything actually. But on to the answer to the question, FINALLY! In 3rd or 4th grade, whichever it was, we were taught that no matter what the number, whenever it’s multiplied by ZERO, you will always get the same number! So, if you multiply this number (pssssstttt…ZERO!) by any other number the answer will be the same! The number is ZERO! Wouldn’t you rather have had me just say ZERO, or 0, right from the start?
The answer is 1 For example, 1 x 2 = 2 1 x 20482719 = 20482719 1 x 61 = 61 Therefore a number when multiplied by another number but is still the same number is 1 Ranger out
